snippet: Union leaders for Chicago’s public schoolteachers said they would strike Monday morning after negotiations ended late Sunday with no contract agreement.
abstract: Chicago public schoolteachers say they will strike after negotiations end with no contract agreement between their union and the nation's third largest school system; looming strike, coming so early in the school year, is expected to affect hundreds of thousands of families.
lead_paragraph: Union leaders for Chicago’s public schoolteachers said they would strike Monday morning after negotiations ended late Sunday with no contract agreement.

headline.seo: Union Leaders Say Teachers in Chicago Will Strike
headline.main: With No Contract Deal by Deadline in Chicago, Teachers Will Strike
headline.print_headline: With No Contract Deal by Deadline in Chicago, Teachers Will Strike
